direction.raw_text: : In the darkness, we hear a voice, a woman's voice.  Her name is Evey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her voice has a strength that is metered by a calmness, a deep centered peace that we can feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the darkness, we find a lantern.  Guy Fawkes, a dangerous man who wears a goatee, is struggling with a wheelbarrow stacked with barrels of gunpowder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wheelbarrow bumps over the heavy stone mortar of the cellar floor.  From the dark depths, we hear the sound of dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy sees lanterns coming from both sides.  He tries to run as the dogs reach him first.  He grabs for his sword as dozens of pole axes pin him against the tunnel's stone wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the dim pre-dawn light, Guy is led to the gallows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The coarse noose of rope is snugged up to Guy's throat.  He looks into the crowd until he finds a face, a woman's face, staring up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lever is thrown and the woman looks down, a tear falling down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy's body hangs in silhouette, lifeless against a red morning sun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "Remember, remember, the fifth of November, the gunpowder treason and plot.  I know of now reason why the gunpowder treason should ever be forgot."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Those were almost the very first words he spoke to me and, in a way, that is where this story began, four hundred years ago, in a cellar beneath the Houses of Parliament.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) In 1605, Guy Fawkes attempted to blow up the Houses of Parliament.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He was caught in the cellars with enough gunpowder to level most of London.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Sometimes I wonder where we would be if he hadn't failed.  I wonder if it would have mattered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I suppose the answer is in the rhyme.  More than the man, what we must remember is the plot itself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) For in the plot we find more than just a man, we find the idea of that man, the spirit of that man, and that is what we must never forget.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) This, then, is the story of that idea, of that spirit that began with an anarchist's plot four hundred years ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A young Evey sits on her father's lap, combing her Barbie's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her father sits beside her mother on the living room couch, watching the news.  From the look on their faces, the news is bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The television flickers with images of heavily armed soldiers fighting in a shelled city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Evey sees her father staring at her mother.  They take hold of each other's hand, clasping them tight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I was born near the end of the millennium, the year 1997.  My father used to say that people were so afraid that the world was going to end that they were willing it to happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't remember much of the century's turn.  I don't remember the market crash or the plague or any of the Trafalgar riots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I've read about them since but I don't recall how any of them impacted my life except for the fear.  They would hide it from me, like a secret between them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But I could feel it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is a new day.  People are gathered along the street as if they were waiting for a parade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey holds her father's hand.  Unable to see what is coming, she can hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear them, hundreds of marching soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Evey hides in the forest of adults, clinging to her father's leg, staring as row after row of boots march by with military precision.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Of the chaos that seemed to swallow the beginning of the 21st century, there is one thing I do remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Very clearly, I can remember that sound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And I remember those boots, black leather that gleamed bright in the morning sun.  I had never seen such boots.  All moving in perfect unison.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the midst of a political rally for the emerging new party calling itself Norsefire, we find little Evey now on her father's shoulders. Dascombe, a young man, paces the podium, inciting the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam Susan rises and the crowd cheers.  Evey's father looks at her mother and again they clasp hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The time has come, London, to return to a bygone age, an age of tradition, an age of values that have been disparaged and all but forgotten.  What this country needs is a leader!  A true leader to remind us of that age.  A righteous leader with the strength of his moral convictions to do what must be done.  I give you that man!  I give you our leader!  Adam Susan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It must have seemed so easy to them.  They offered such a simple deal; give up control and we will restore order.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Little Evey is asleep in her bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A loud crash of splintering wood wakes her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of heavy boots swarms through the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her bedroom door bursts open and a heavily armed soldier scoops her up. She is carried through the dark house which is filled with soldiers.  On the floor of the living room, she sees her parents being bound with plastic zip-ties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A heavy black hood is pulled over each of her parent's heads as Evey is carried out of the house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) At first, the arrests were political.  Dissidents.  Radicals. Liberals.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) When my parents were younger, they had been activists.  They had marched with Labor in the great train strike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mommy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My daughter!  Don't take my daughter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Evey!  Evey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mommy!  Daddy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I never saw them again.  Overnight, my life, my entire world was erased.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A nun with a switch in her crossed arms watches as Evey and several other little girls scrub the floor of a dormitory bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tear rolls down Little Evey's cheek.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It was done so quickly and violently, so completely, that it began to seem that it had never even existed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A gay man is dragged violently from his Piccadilly home. Outside, he sees his lover being forced to the cobblestones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches for him as the clubs rise and fall, vicious and bloody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In another neighborhood, we see the police arresting Pakistanis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a different area, young black men are packed into a caged van so tightly they are unable to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A young detective named Finch looks down as the van pulls away.  When he looks up, another man in a military uniform whose name is Almond is watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch sticks his pipe in his mouth and turns away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The homosexuals were next.  What God had started with AIDS had to be finished by man.  It was God's work.  That's what we were told.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But once they were gone, there was someone else.  Someone different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Someone dangerous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) There were those who understood what was happening, who knew it was wrong but who kept silent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And in the vacuum of that silence, order was imposed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Again, we see the marching boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We move through the columns of marching soldiers to a wall where a poster has been plastered up.  The poster reads, "Strength Through Purity, Purity Through Faith."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the sound of the marching fades, a shadow falls over the sign. After a moment, we hear the hiss of spray paint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shadow sprays a "V" over the poster.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Order that was like those boots, order that required rigorous discipline.  Order that is exactly the same, where each single step falls with every step.  The order of the many shaped into one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Somehow in my heart, I knew it wouldn't last.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What they thought they had crushed, the spirit they believed trampled and ground beneath the marching of their boots, rose up, rose as if from a four hundred year old grave, rose to remind us all that day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Close on a loudspeaker.  There is one on every major street corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beneath the loudspeaker is a surveillance system labeled, "For your protection." Bubble eyed lenses iris at the end of stalks that move, insect-like, racheting and clicking as they watch a little girl pedal her bicycle.  The little girl glances nervously over her shoulder up at the mechanical eyes watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT.  EVEY'S APARTMENT There is a radio on a small makeup table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey is now a young woman.  She slips into a dress that is little more than a nightgown.  She tries to adjust it, pulling it down at the hem, pulling it up at the thin shoulder straps, but it is like trying to hide behind a lamppost.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Good evening, London.  It's nine o'clock, the fourth of November in the year 2019 and this is the voice of Fate broadcasting on 275 and 285 of the medium wave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) People of London, be advised --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: that Braxton and Streathon are quarantine zones as of today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It is suggested that these area be avoided for reasons of health and safety.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Another radio in a room that seems to be of another world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man enters the room as he once entered the world.  His body is lean and strong and though we do not see his face, there is a strength in his carriage, a power to his presence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Good news following the productivity reports from Herefordshire indicating a possible end to meat rationing starting mid February.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She packs tissue paper into the toes of a pair of high heels that are too big for her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Police raided seventeen homes in the Birmingham area, uncovering what is believed to be a major terrorist ring.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We move over a dressing bureau, past a wig and over a pair of black leather gloves, moving until we find the mask; it is like something from the masquerade ball of another era.  It has an exaggerated goatee, harlequin cheeks and a smile, forever fixed, at once be-guiling and be-deviling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Twenty eight people, eight of them women, are currently in detention awaiting trial.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey coats her lips with a lascivious red.  She stares into the mirror, her makeup like a mask over her own face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And that is the face of London tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The man, now fully dressed in cloak, hat, and mask gazes into the mirror. This is V.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And this is the voice of Fate signing off and bidding you a pleasant evening.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Close on Evey's high heels, stumbling and awkward as she walks down a dark cobblestoned street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on V's boots walking in the opposite direction so that it seems they are walking towards each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't know what brought us together that night.  I had never been to that part of Westminster but ever since I've known him, I've stopped believing in coincidence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey looks up and sees a man standing mostly in shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man turns around.  It is not V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She presses her body to his, using her little girl eyes and her woman's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls out his wallet and shows her a badge.  The sight of it knocks the breath out of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey turns and there are more Fingermen behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Fingermen laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fingerman 2 laughs hard as he drops his pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shoves her face first against a brick wall, lifting her dress to expose her bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, they are no longer alone. V "The multiplying villainies of nature do swarm upon him."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the clenched fist of black leather, we see a flash of steel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V attacks and at once we know this is no normal human being. A single blow sends the largest of the Fingermen flying backwards. But more than his strength, it is his speed. A gun is cocked but before the hammer falls, a knife is buried in the Fingerman's chest and -- Before the body falls, the knife is gone. It takes a handful of seconds and three bodies lay on the ground.  V turns to the last Fingerman who is struggling to pull his pants up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V steps forward and he screams, bolting while holding his pants up. V Good evening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws wide his cloak and bows deeply to her. V And you would be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear sirens rushing towards them.  In a blink, he scoops her up and dashes into the shadows of a narrow alleyway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me?  Uh... excuse me, Mister?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like... uh, would you like to sleep with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean, for money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is the clumsiest bit of propositioning I've ever heard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god, I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is this your first time, darling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, no, I mean for money.  But I know what you want and I'll do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything you want, mister.  Please, I need the money.  I know I'm young but I promise I know what I'm doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  You don't know what you're doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Christ, you're a Fingerman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give the little lady a prize.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got something to give her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Prostitution is a class H offense. Know what that means?  It means that we get to exercise our own judicial discretion -- FINGERMAN 2 And you get to swallow it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god, please.  It's my first time.  Please don't hurt me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gosh, fellas, look at those big innocent eyes.  What do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spare the rod, spoil the child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, don't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You heard the man, sweetie.  This rod's for your own good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell -- V "And fortune, on his damned quarrel, smiling, showed like a rebel's whore."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're police officers, pal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're with the Finger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So bugger off! V "Disdaining fortune with his brandished steel, which smoked with bloody execution."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's got a knife!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ!  Don't hurt me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who -- Who are you? V Me?  I imagine all manner of names shall be heaped upon my humble visage but, for now, let us simply say I am the villain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Evey. V Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Police cars and several ambulances swarm over the area with the dead Fingermen. V watches them from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes out an old antique pocket watch.  It is almost midnight. V Almost time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks out where, rising above the rooftops, he can see Big Ben. V "Remember, remember, the fifth of November, the gunpowder treason and plot.  I know of no reason why the gunpowder treason should ever be forgot." The second hand sweeps into the final minute. V Tell me, Evey, what good is an actor that plays his part to an empty theatre?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From his sleeve, he pulls a conductor's wand. V Can you hear it?  It's already begun. He begins to lightly tap the wand in the air and, very faintly, we hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He continues to conduct and we begin to hear the music, violins and horns that seem almost like a whisper or a wind that steadily swells. V Ahh, yes.  There it is.  Beautiful, is it not? He turns to the parapet, his gestures growing grander as the music rises and we recognize Tchaikovsky's 1812 overture. The music mounts a climax and V points the wand at Big Ben as cymbals crash -- Big Ben explodes with such force the world seems to shake, while -- V, smiling, always smiling, points again with another crescendo and -- The statue of justice is blown to smithereens. V nods in appreciation while mustering the music towards it's finale as fireworks begin lighting up the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everywhere across the city, people stand transfixed by the dazzling shimmer of the fireworks until -- A strobing final blitz leaves a single, starry image floating in the smoke filled sky. It is the letter V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From every direction, the city screams with the panicked sound of sirens.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why did you do that?  Why did you... help me? V Why indeed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what? V For the music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Music? V Yes, music.  My music.  You see. Evey, I am a performer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that why you're wearing a mask? V We all wear masks.  Life creates them and forces us to find the one that fits.  Do you know what day it is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh... November fourth. V Not for long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. V Nor do I.  That's why you are here. I need you, Evey.  I need someone to listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To your music? V Yes.  Yes, to my music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't hear anything. V At first, you have to listen very carefully...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's beautiful... V Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A massive modern building that is the seat of the new government. A long, black car pulls up to the entrance.  Adam Susan gets out, wearing a long black trenchcoat over his pajamas.  He is the Leader and he looks older, heavier, and meaner. He hurries past the heavily armed guards, barely acknowledging the snap and cock of their Nazi-like salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader enters his main chambers and we see the Fate computer system. It is a cerebral cortex for a vast intelligence network. Information can almost be felt coursing through its hard drives. The Leader sits, at once regaining a measure of composure. He takes a deep calming breath and accesses the system. Dozens of monitors fill with images from all across the city, most of them are of the damage caused by V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conrad Heyer appears on one of the screens.  He is at his desk inside the command center for the Eye, the governmental organization responsible for the visual surveillance systems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On an insert screen, we see grainy footage of V rescuing Evey from one of the pole-mounted cameras.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the last body falls, V seems to pause and looks back over his shoulder straight into the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader stares at the smiling face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bunny Etheridge appears on another screen.  Behind him, huge spooling reels of audiotape wind constantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch, no longer the same young man, stands at the site of the fireworks launch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An intercom opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They answer in unison as Almond enters the office.  His face is harder but he has the same violent gleam in his eye. The Leader turns in his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almond does not.  The Leader leaps from his chair while pounding the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves around the desk at Almond.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, I will hear your reports now.  Mr. Heyer, speak for the Eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have less than two minutes of usable footage, Leader.  It took the suspect less than a minute to dispatch the Finger's vice patrol.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As you can see, the suspect's reflex speed is extraordinary.  As is his strength.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Freeze it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid the mask makes retinal identification impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Etheridge, report for the Ear!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were able to triangulate the origin of the fireworks.  We also are currently monitoring a lot of phone surveillance indicating a high percentage of conversation concerned with the explosions.  All suspect or significant transcripts are being forwarded to Mr. Almond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very good.  Mr. Finch, speak for the Nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks to Etheridge, we found the launch for the fireworks.  These appear to be individually weighted flares and we have found traces of the same chemicals at both of the detonation sites which leads us to conclude that, despite a level of sophistication, these devices are all home-made with over the counter chemicals, making them impossible to trace.  Whoever he is, Leader, he's good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for that professional annotation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Leader, Mr. Almond has arrived.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very good.  Gentlemen, keep me informed of any further developments.  England prevails.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Almond, do you know what this is behind me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh... the Fate computer system, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  No sir.  It's more than that. This, this computer is a symbol, Mr. Almond.  A symbol of the highest attainable goal of mankind. Do you know what that goal is, Mr. Almond?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Control, Mr. Almond!  Control!  The world around us is a changing, directionless, amoral morass and it is up to man and man alone to set things right!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Without control, man is nothing more than any other stinking, sweating, brute animal.  Control, Mr. Almond.  The control that we have painstakingly built up over the last ten years.  Now, do you understand what happened last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We... lost control.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Mr. Almond.  Last night someone did the unthinkable. Someone hurt us.  It is imperative that we act swiftly and precisely. I want that man found, Mr. Almond. I want his head or, by god, I'll have yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey is wearing a blindfold and V leads her by her fingertips, guiding her almost as if they were dancing... His fingers slip free of her and she reaches out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is behind her and he removes the blindfold, revealing his house to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a labyrinth of interconnecting underground tunnels and rooms. The gallery is the main room as it is filled with an amazing collection of human culture.  There is art that spans from the renaissance to the painted covers of Eerie comics, literature that ranges from Shakespeare to Spillane, philosophy from Plato to Bukowski, and a vast collection of nonfiction. There are movie posters everywhere and an entire wall is lined with videocassettes. A jukebox stands in front of an enormous vinyl and CD collection of music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She punches a button and Billie Holiday begins to sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops suddenly and looks at him.  The offer is terribly exciting but it is so unlike anything she has ever done that it's almost impossible to imagine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she returns his smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wait.  I've lost you. V No, you haven't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A jukebox?  Where did you get it? V I saved it.  Like everything here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, it's beautiful.  I've never heard anything like it. V Of course not.  You grew up in their world.  Art is created by individuals and there are no individuals in a world where you are told what to think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This place is amazing. V You're welcome to stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay here... with you? V Yes.  If you like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... I don't even know your name. V I don't have a name.  But you can call me V.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ?  V... I like that.

direction.raw_text: The smiling mask stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Derek pulls back the hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Click.  He never loaded it. There is an awkward moment of silence, then V moves -- Cloak opening, filling the hall like a black tidal wave that envelopes Derek.  He chokes a scream as V embraces him, slipping a knife above his floating rib. Derek Almond sputters as he claws at V's mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rips V's mask off as V thrusts the knife in deeper. Derek's eyes widen in horror as his life pours out the knife wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V jerks his blade free, letting Derek slip to the ground.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't move an inch, you bloody bastard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't hear me arrive, did you? Didn't know we'd rumbled you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all finished, chummy.  All of it.  The old man told me it was my head or yours and what do you know. It's yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you're standing over there with your bloody stupid knives and your fancy karate gimmicks --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I've got a gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bang.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who -- Who are you? V Yes, look.  Look and tell me what you see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Horrible!  God, it's horrible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DELIA SURRIDGE'S HOME Finch's car bucks up onto the sidewalk. Finch and Dominic tear out of the car and barrel into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  DELIA SURRIDGE'S HOME At the top of the stairs, they find the dead Derek.  Finch rushes past him for the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside, he finds her.  Her eyes fixed, cold, and dead, a single violet carson in her lap.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Delia?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get an ambulance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DELIA SURRIDGE'S HOME Evey rushes around a corner to see a crime scene bathed in siren light.  She pushes up to the police barricade as the M.E.'s load a draped body into their van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to angle around to get a better look when a man in a brown overcoat grabs her from behind and drags her into the alley.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no... V?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From the corner of the room, Finch sits, watching as the M.E.'s wheel out Delia's body. Dominic squeezes past the gurney and crosses toward Finch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dominic searches for something more to say when Finch does not answer. After a moment, Finch looks at the book in Dominic's hand, then takes it, leafing through the pages.  They flip by, a breathy sigh, rising to a cold wind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir.  You knew the doctor pretty well?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We found this on her bureau, sir. It's Dr. Surridge's journal.  It covers her years at Larkhill.  It might contain the whole story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) May 23rd...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK A younger Dr. Surridge, one by one, administers a series of injections to her research stock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She finishes an injection, Prothero encouraging the next subject.  We recognize her as the woman Prothero pointed at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delia prepares the next dose, a sour look on her face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Prothero has hand picked my subjects.  Four dozen of them, none of which will be any use to me if I don't get to work soon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They're so weak and pathetic I find myself hating them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They don't fight or struggle.  Just stare at you with weak eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK Two inmate orderlies are hefting sacked cadavers from a cart into an incinerator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another body thuds onto the pile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When it is full, they move to the next door until the cart is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red heat suddenly glows from the oven vents as the orderly throws a series of switches.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) June 9th: Of the original four dozen, over 75% are now deceased. Strangely, no clear patterns have emerged as of yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Batch 5 seems to have no common discernible effect on any specific group though the men seem slightly more resilient than the women.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm hoping the survivors will provide more answers or my time here will have gone to waste.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK Dr. Surridge moves down the drab aseptic hallway accompanied by an armed guard.  Roman numerals on the doors to each cell ascend to five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pauses at room five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks through the small chicken wire glass window in the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the back, just on the edge of the room's shadow, sits the man in room five, silently staring back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Surridge can't seem to break her stare.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) June 18: And only five left now. Two men and three women.  Which tends to contradict my entry on the 9th.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The man in room five is a fascinating case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Physically, there doesn't seem to be anything wrong with him.  No cellular anomalies, nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Batch five, however, seems to have brought on some kind of psychotic breakdown.  He's quite insane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He has this way of looking through you.  Reverend Lilliman won't go near him.  He claims that it is the devil in room five.  I see him cross himself whenever he passes his door.  Still, there's something about him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK Dr. Surridge slowly moves through the Larkhill garden, an incredible abundance of fruits, vegetables and violet carson roses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She traces the petals of a rose with her finger.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm glad Prothero let room five have a go at the gardening project. He is quite proficient.  Prothero was reluctant to allow an inmate access to the tool and chemical supply at first but now the fat toad is delighted.  The crop has almost doubled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He also grows roses.  Beautiful roses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - FLASHBACK Dr. Surridge and several other Larkhill appointees relax after dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A massive explosion shakes the building to its very core, its windows shattering and hooded pendulum lights swinging.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) December 24th: I was in the mess. It was about half past ten when we heard the first explosion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - FLASHBACK Men and women clutch at their throats as they tumble out into the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They drop to the ground, gasping and vomiting. The back door is kicked open, Dr. Surridge following two guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks out, men running, collapsing, dying in a yellow green haze that seems everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another explosion wracks the compound.  The pillar of flame rises into the black sky, dwarfing the men in the camp. Dr. Surridge sees a gaping hole in the medical block, its insides turned out like an unholy birth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on a soldier, doubled over, hacking up bile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sticky blue fire licks up from a blackened body like a dura flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Surridge turns as a silhouette crosses the yard, backlit by a curtain of fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Surridge seems to wilt under his stare but cannot look away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flames convulse hypnotically behind him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The ones at the front ran straight into the gas.  It was horrible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) A few of us made it out through the rear door.  You could hear men screaming everywhere.  I hate the sound of men screaming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) In the center of the camp, everything was on fire.  Everyone running in all directions.  We had hardly enough time to get our bearings when the ovens exploded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It was the man in room rive.  I couldn't have known.  The chemical supplies, grease solvents, ammonia, fertilizer.  He'd been making things with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Mustard gas...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And napalm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And in the yard, I saw him.  He had the flames behind him.  He was naked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He looked at me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) As if I were an insect.  Oh god. As if I were something mounted on a slide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He looked at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Finch snaps Dr. Surridge's journal shut. He sits in front of the Leader's desk puffing on his pipe while Susan stares coldly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses the journal on Susan's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch rises, crossing to the wastebasket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He taps his pipe into his hand, pouring the contents into the wastebasket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch brushes the ashes from his hands and begins repacking his pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan raises his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he finishes repacking the pipe, he replaces it in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch begins relighting his pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A flame leaps into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another burst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lighter slips back into his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch returns to his chair, letting out a huge cloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan punches the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And punches it again until his fist hurts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan's collar chokes his face to an unnatural crimson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a moment, Finch stands, Susan hanging on his last word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch turns, Susan calling after him as he leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch pauses at the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's the last entry until six months later when Dr. Surridge is back in London.  There is no mention of the man in room five again.  End of story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Except that it wasn't the end of the story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Between 2009 and 2012, over forty men and women who were previously stationed at Larkhill met with what were believed to be accidental deaths.  Eventually, only three remained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The three he'd been saving until last.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everyone who worked at Larkhill. Everyone who could have identified him.  You see there are two possible motives here.  Not one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The first is revenge.  He escapes from Larkhill and vows to get even with his tormentors.  The whole exercise an elaborate, chilling vendetta.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the explanation that I find most reassuring, funnily enough. Because that means he's finished. It's over now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The second motive is more sinister. Like I said, everyone who could have identified him is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if he's just been clearing the ground?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if he's planning something else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You see, the diary we found was in full view.  We didn't have to search for it.  He left it there. He wanted us to find it.  He wanted us to know the story.  Or...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For all we know, the diary could be a complete and utter fake. Codename V could have written it himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's playing games with us.  He might never have been at Larkhill at all.  Do you see?  It could all be another smoke screen, a false trail, another cover story -- LEADER Enough!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Finch, would you please explain to me the nature of this meeting?! Because I was under the impression that you had some information about the terrorist, codename V!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No more questions, understand!  I want answers!  I am not interested in where he grew up, what kind of flowers he likes or his favorite color!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do I make myself clear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Leader.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dismissed.  England prevails, Mr. Finch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Finch, the girl.  Do you have anything on the girl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Leader.  Not yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey stirs as voices drift in from the hall outside her door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three guards are silhouetted in the doorway of a cramped jail cell.  Still sluggish from the chloroform, Evey looks down at the coarse slipover she's now wearing. One of the men, Rossiter, crosses toward Evey, swinging a pair of shackles.  He grabs Evey, slamming her face down into the hard cot, driving a knee between her shoulder blades. Evey screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shackles bite down on her wrists as they laugh in the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter stands her up, shoving her into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slides a thick hood over her head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wake up, cow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tsk.  This pathetic whore is the famous Miss Hammond?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've made a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please.  I haven't done anything --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said shut your hole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The hood is lifted from her head.  Evey squints hard, awash in a blinding, burning light. A man sits, unmoving, at a desk across from her, a guard at his side, both backlit by a harsh white kliegs. Evey's eyes start to water as she blinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A monitor next to the desk lights up.  From the snowy static, an image begins to form. A girl is talking to a man.  She is shoving her hips at him, propositioning him.  When more men appear from the alley, Evey realizes she is watching herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter grabs a handful of her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She swallows hard when she sees V emerge on the screen.  The image freezes on his smiling face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monitor blinks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter slips the hood back over Evey's head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know why you're here.  Evey Hammond?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, please, I didn't do anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Allow me to be more precise.  Did you participate in the murder of Dr. Delia Surridge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you participate in the murder of Derek Almond, director of the Finger?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I -- INTERROGATOR Did you participate in the murder of Bishop Anthony Lilliman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god, I don't -- INTERROGATOR Have you ever participated in a terrorist act against your country?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- INTERROGATOR What is the identity of codename V?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are a lying cunt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They were going to rape me, kill me --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This board will not tolerate any more of your lies, Miss Hammond. We have over 120 minutes of audio and videotape and 75 pages of testimonials from eye witness that identify you as an accomplice to the terrorist, codename V.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want to know why you're here?  You are formally being brought up on charges of murder on fourteen counts and sedition against your Leader and country which brings an automatic sentence of death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please.  I didn't do anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Process the prisoner and return her to her cell until she is more cooperative.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey cries as a rough hand runs a pair of electric clippers over her head.  Huge sheaves of her hair fall to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey lies crumpled on the hard floor, unmoving, as a tray of food is slid through a slot at the bottom of the door. She watches as a rat crosses from a hole in the wall, sniffing the murky rendered gelatin in the wooden bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey hangs limply from a set of manacles as she is washed and deloused by heavy hands. She coughs in the yellow bug powder cloud as it burns her eyes and the red welts on her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey is curled up on the cot like a dry fetus, now gaunt arms wrapped around her legs.  She blinks when she hears something moving in the rat hole. Evey raises her head as something is pushed through the crevice. Tentative fingers search the hole, pulling out a length of toilet paper.  Over every inch of it is a delicately scrawled message. We move into the rathole, its edges slowly filling the frame until black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull back from a shadow, the outline of the interrogator's silhouette against sharp light coming into frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter is buckling Evey's thin arms and legs into a chair. Her now frail frame can barely hold up the frayed brown slipover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the table in front of her, there is a large wash basin of water.  Rossiter dunks her head into it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I read her letter.  Hid it.  Slept. Woke.  They questioned me.  And I read her letter again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Over and over...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Her name was Valerie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK A teacher reads from her lesson plan in front of rows and rows of uniformed pubescences in this all girl private school.  Her voice drones on and on like Muzak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blonde tomboy sneaks a smile to her curly haired friend next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her hand slides across the desk, fingers tickling the young flesh of Sara's wrist. The teacher's voice slows, dropping octaves, becoming -- INT.  BIOLOGY LAB - DAY - FLASHBACK A man's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valerie looks at Sara across the room, her head down in shame.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I was born in a rainy burg in Nottingham in 1975.  I passed my eleven plus and went to girl's grammar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I met my first girlfriend at school.  Her name was Sara.  Her wrists.  Her wrists were beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I sat in biology class staring at the pickled rabbit fetus while Mr. Herd said it was an adolescent phase that people outgrew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Sara did.  I didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK Two teenage girls stand in front of a middle aged couple. They are holding hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The greying woman repeats the sign of the cross over and over, sobbing into a handkerchief.  Her husband's face is contorted in disgust.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) In 1994, I stopped pretending and took a girl called Christine home to meet my parents.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) A week later I moved to London to go to college and study drama.  My mother said I broke her heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK Two young women cuddle on a park bench under a London summer sky, feeding the pigeons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The black haired girl nibbles on the blonde's ear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But it was my integrity that was important.  Is that so selfish?  It sells for so little but it's all we have left in this place...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It is the very last inch of us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey struggles against Rossiter's weight who keeps her head submerged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter wrenches back and Evey sucks hard for air, coughing out water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey stares at him, eyes red, heart pounding in her ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey begins to shake her head, water sluicing off her thin face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter grabs Evey's neck -- EVEY No, wait! Plunging her head into the bowl.  Water fills Evey's nose and ears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But within that inch we are free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now Miss Hammond, let us review the facts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You work for codename V.  Codename V killed Delia Surridge and then Derek Almond with your help and that is why you were found outside her home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that what happened, Miss Hammond?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  No, that isn't true -- INTERROGATOR Oh dear, Rossiter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) London.  I was happy in London.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - FLASHBACK The packed house watches as a Prince kneels before a woman's bare foot with a slipper of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman glances into the dark sea of faces.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I played Dandini in Cinderella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The world was strange and rustling with invisible crowds behind the hot lights and all that breathless glamour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK Two women weep in each other's arms, embracing in a perfect knee high meadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blonde woman brushes away a tear from the other's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pull back and see we are on location for a movie and the two women are being filmed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Work improved.  I got small film roles, then bigger ones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) In 2006, I starred in "The Salt Flats."  That's where I met Ruth. We fell in love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - FLASHBACK Ruth and Valerie sit on the couch watching television.  On the table behind them is a bouquet of violet carson roses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two women stare at the newscast in tears, the sound of marching coming from the set's speakers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Every Valentine's Day she sent me roses and, oh god, we had so much. Those were the best three years of my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) In 2010, they came.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - FLASHBACK The sound of marching explodes as columns of men in brown uniforms and jack boots fill the streets.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And after that there were no more roses...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rossiter presses his elbow onto Evey's neck, holding her submerged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter lets Evey up.  Her red burnt lungs gulp at the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey blinks hard, black fireworks exploding in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wheezes, on the edge of unconsciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The interrogator's voice melts into a slag heap of sound with the hot, rhythmic pounding in her ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter uncuffs Evey, slipping the black bag over her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey's knees buckle as he forces her to stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey weaves down the hall.  Rossiter shoving her from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cell door swings open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rossiter yanks the hood from her head and pushes her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The iron door slams shut, lock ringing in the stale air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey rolls to her knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crawls for the rat hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her shaking hand pulls the letter from the stone crevice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey clutches it like a rosary as she begins to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds the note to her face, her tears soaking into the fragile paper.
