direction.raw_text: He touches her and it is all she needs.  She buries her face into his chest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now what's this all about, Mrs. Heyer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, forgive me.  I've been so afraid, afraid to come here to talk to you.  I thought he must know.  I was terrified he knew but I had to come because I knew you were the only one that can protect me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Protect you from what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come now, Mrs. Heyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You won't let him hurt me, will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let who hurt you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The terrorist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The terrorist is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, how I wanted to believe it, Leader, but I know it's not true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I know who the terrorist is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Conrad is alone with Fate.  He glances about nervously, moving closer and closer.  His fingers reach out and graze the main keyboard.  Taking a deep breath, he turns and begins to type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader takes hold of Helen by her shoulders.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who?  Who is it, woman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's Conrad, Leader.  Conrad.  My husband is the terrorist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Conrad accesses the department of water and power.  He finds the correct file and begins rerouting power to a once dead system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hanging light suddenly sizzles to life.  V looks up, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader stares hard at Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She clutches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tears well up in Helen's eyes as she shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes fly wide and he spins away from her, throwing open the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw him, Leader.  In the middle of the night.  I heard something. I went to the landing and that's when I saw it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That mask.  That hideous smiling mask.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how did you know it was Heyer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, Leader.  I know the way a woman knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you have no proof?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Proof?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, proof?  This is an extremely delicate situation, Mrs. Heyer.  It has been reported that the terrorist is dead.  It would be a catastrophe to arrest a man now without concrete, conclusive proof. Do you have any evidence at all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But if you're right, if Heyer is indeed the terrorist...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leader!  Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Conrad sits calmly across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant appears almost instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen looks up at the Leader, a smile hidden near the corners of her perfect red lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is everything all right?  Helen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Mr. Heyer, your wife has done her duty to her country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, Mrs. Heyer.  You will be taken care of.  I will launch an immediate investigation and I promise, you will be the first to know when an arrest will be made.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Investigation of what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Subversion, Mr. Heyer.  Your wife was privy to the dialogue of subversives.  That's all you need to know at this time.  Lieutenant!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Heyers are leaving.  I need to see Mr. Creedy at once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Helen and Conrad get out of the elevator, standing beneath the rows of new party flags that line the lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She embraces him, pressing her body against his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She almost kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiling, she pivots on her heel and heads for the door.  He reaches for her when -- GUARD Mr. Heyer!  Mr. Heyer! The front desk guard rushes towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands him a small, brown wrapped box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks back for Helen but she is already gone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to go straight to your office and wait for me to call. When I do, I want you to come immediately home.  Understood?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Helen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Conrad, I'm so proud of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did it, Helen.  I did it, didn't I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tonight, Conrad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise you will never forget tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, Conrad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, this package arrived for you, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A single flashlight beam creeps toward us as Finch searches the detritus of the dead train line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitting at a stoplight, Conrad decides to open the package. Inside is a cassette tape.  The light changes and a car behind him honks.  He starts forward and inserts the tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch crawls up onto the platform of V's hidden station, staring at the beautiful old train car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strangling the steering wheel, Conrad listens to the tape. The speedometer climbs as everything seems to accelerate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen moans.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Do you know what I want?  I want you just like this... bent over that black leather chair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Finch steps inside the car, his flashlight sweeping over the stacks of gelignite.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my god.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A scream builds in Conrad.  With tears in his eyes, he stares out the windshield but sees only the images created by the tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conrad loses control and the car careens up onto the sidewalk and smashes into a brick wall. Lifting his bloodied forehead, Conrad looks out and sees the ubiquitous poster partially destroyed by the crash: "Strength through purity, purity through faith."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Use the Finger?... You mean like this?... Oh... That's vulgar... But you like it?... Yes... oh yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Finch hears something and jerks back, almost falling out of the car.  Aiming his gun, he finds no one.  He turns and bolts. As the sound of his footsteps fade, V steps out of the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader's Lieutenant looks up from his desk and sees Finch rushing towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch charges through the doors.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is the Leader in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but he's meeting with the Captain of the Guard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perfect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Finch, you can't go in --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Leader and his Captain turn.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Finch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leader, I need as many men the Captain can spare and I need them right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To capture codename V.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Creedy opens the trunk of his car.  In the phosphorescent glow of the streetlight, the set of knives gleam.  He bundles the costume that he tried to planet on Finch into his arms, then slams the trunk. Above, a window blind that was cracked open snaps shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader moves towards Finch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's underground.  The old subway. I know exactly what he's going to do.  If we move quickly, we can be there, waiting for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Conrad waits, hidden inside a bedroom closet.  He hears the front door close and his grip tightens around the handle of a long, steel-necked hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader is steadily convincing himself of something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader lifts his hand, silencing Finch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch is suddenly overwhelmed by a feeling that is common to chess players.  It is the disturbing sense that you have just done exactly what your opponent wanted.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Leader, every second we delay...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm coming with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir -- LEADER There will be no discussion -- GUARD But if Mr. Finch is right -- LEADER I am sick to death of this terrorist being everywhere and nowhere!  I will judge whether Mr. Finch is right and I will judge it with my own eyes!  Do I make myself clear, Captain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a problem, Mr. Finch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good.  Captain, mobilize your men.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll find this bloody bastard and we will finish him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey sits in the gallery, reading Pynchon's "V" just as V had done.  She suddenly feels V watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey smiles as V steps out of the shadows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ? V Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: what's going to happen? V Change, Evey.  That's all.  Just change.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it going to be violent? V Yes, I suppose it will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Creedy empties a bottom drawer, making room to hide the costume.  As he does, the closet door behind him slowly creeps open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V stands at the jukebox.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But why?  Why must is be violent? V Because, Evey, that is the nature of change.  She is a temperamental creature that appears in earnest rarely but, when she does, she will wear one of two faces.  The first face is the destroyer.  It is lamentable but all true change begins with death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A dark figure stands over Creedy.  The hammer raises, a slash of silver against the velvety darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V punches a button on the jukebox just as -- INT.  CONRAD'S HOUSE The hammer falls with a sickening soft crunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The song begins to play; a melancholy song that says goodbye to love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood pours down Creedy's snarling face, he snatches one of V's knives as another hammer blow cracks through his collar bone. He screams, lunging at Conrad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V listens to the song, the smiling eyes somehow knowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hammer falls again and again until the metal head is slick with blood and meat. Conrad stumbles back, dropping the hammer.  He looks down at the hilt of the knife protruding from his stomach.  He yanks it out and holds V's knife which is bright red with his own blood. He collapses to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The song continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey smiles and crosses to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens his arms and she steps into them.  They dance, standing very close, his gloved hand holding tightly to hers, her smile against his.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is the other face, V? V The other face?  She is the true face of change.  The face of the creator.  She is the one that remakes the world.  Evey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, V? V May I ask you for a favor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. V It is a small thing but it would mean a great deal to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me. V I've never danced before.  I've thought about it many times, here in this room, listening to the music.  But I've always been alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It would be my pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dozens of military vehicles swarm around the entrance to Victoria Station while heavily armed men pour through the gates of the underground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The song ends. V Thank you, Evey.  You are an excellent dancer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bows, pressing his frozen lips to her hand.  Evey is suddenly nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She seizes hold of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lets him go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All it takes is a little practice. V Alas, I have run out of time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ?  What are you going to do? V Don't you remember?  I have a date tonight, Evey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're coming back though, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't let you leave unless you promise me that you will come back. V Of course, I'll be back.  You don't think you can be rid of me now, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just promise. V I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Soldiers swarm through the station.  Susan stares in shock, outraged by the mere presence of the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to the Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the lights go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mark my words, Mr. Finch, this man is going to become an example so that every man, woman, and child in this country will remember what happens to those who would ever think to stand against the state.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, I need a gas unit down here with enough nerve gas to fill every rat-hole in these tunnels.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think that will be necessary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are over one hundred of the best trained soldiers in this country down here.  Let him come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Five soldiers creep forward in a tight formation, their flashlights probing every nook and cranny. Behind them, a secret passage opens and V steps out. He is among them with frightful speed, a grinning dervish with blades like metal fangs ripping and rending flesh, slashing bright in the flashlight. Other soldiers rush towards the screams and gunfire but they find only five bodies and warm blood running down the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the opposite end, there is another series of screams and machine gun fire that lights up the dark tunnel for a moment. Then, nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in the tunnels, V drops from above, his cloak a swirling cloud of squid ink that hides him in the darkness. Again, quicksilver knives lash out, drawing fonts of blood.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, what's happening?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) No sign sir.  Repeat, no sign of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They lost him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This... this is a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell me you're a coward, Mr. Finch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Finch can feel the panic that is spreading through the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A voice rings out from hidden speakers, echoing through the tunnels. V (V.O.) Good evening citizens of London. This is the voice of Fate.  Your fate...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader screams to be heard over the resonant voice of V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everywhere, terrified soldiers listen to the voice. V (V.O.) You can choose to stay here and die with your Leader or you can choose to be free.  The decision is yours and yours alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep in the tunnel, two soldiers look at each other. Simultaneously, they drop their guns and run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Groups of solders drop their weapons and disappear into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The station fills with the sound of boots running wildly away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch slowly draws back away from the Leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The few men on the platform are soon the only men left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A knife sings through the air and buries itself in the Captain's chest.  With a tiny rasp, he falls to the ground. The remaining men bolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs for the Captain's machine gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You" echoes down the dark empty throat of the tunnel. The Leader looks around, his flashlight sweeping in big arcs as he realizes that he is alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader screams, whipping around towards the voice. V Alone. The smile is as cold and as sharp as the knife that flicks from his hand. The Leader raises his gun just when the knife sinks into his shoulder. Howling in pain, he drops the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V smiles into the spot of his flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V closes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V draws his final blade. V "He that killeth with the sword, shall be killed with the sword." V raises the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V and the Leader turn to find Finch aiming a machine gun at V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: V does and Susan begins an almost hysterical laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps toward V, staring into his smiling black eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finch ignores the Leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses the gun to the Leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader seethes, his eyes boring into Finch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The machine gun burst shatters the quiet concrete silence. Finch falls dead at V's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He aims the gun at V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Leader laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost casually, V bends down to pick up the knife -- The Leader screams and fires. Bullets knock V back a bit but he continues, grabbing the knife and standing. Eyes widening with disbelief, the Leader fires another blast as V begins walking towards him. The machine gun roars, bullets shredding out through the back of V's cloak as he continues with short deliberate steps until -- The hammer clicks against the pin.  The gun is empty. V stands before him. V You see?  You cannot kill me. There is no flesh and blood within this cloak to kill.  There is only an idea. V smiles. V And ideas are bulletproof. The Leader screams. V drives the knife into his heart, killing him instantly. V stands alone amidst the carnage and seeping pools of red. His body wavers.  He takes his hands out from beneath his cloak and reveals his gloves, wet with blood.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Leader, we have to get out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This was your idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was a mistake.  This is what he wants.  He knows us, Leader.  He knows us too well.  We have to get out of here before it's too late --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What trick is this? V (V.O.) Tonight, the face of London is going to change and I am going to offer you the chance to change with her.  Your Leader is finished.  He will not leave these tunnels alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is an outrage!  I order you not to listen to this! V (V.O.) At midnight tonight, the Head will be destroyed and a new era will begin.  You must now decide if you are going to be a part of that era.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, order all your men to fall back and secure this position! V (V.O.) Some of you have wives.  Some of you have families.  All of you have lives.  Consider each of them as you ask yourself, are they a part of the past, or are they a part of the future?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fall back.  Fall back and secure the central platform.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any man that disobeys this order will be court marshaled!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain!  Captain, where are your men?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddammit, I will not tolerate this insubordination!  I want those deserters shot, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shot on sight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You!  You!  Point position.  We're getting out of here!  Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Traitors!  You cowards!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know who you are!  I'll see you hang!  Every last one of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finch?  Finch!  Finch, goddammit, you can't leave me!  Don't leave me! V You are going to die as you ruled --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn you!  Damn you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Conrad?  Is that you?  You're working with Finch, aren't you? And Creedy!  You're all in this together!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you? V You, most of all, should know, Leader.  You created me.  Without you, I would never be.  More than life, Leader, you gave me purpose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Noooo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Finch!  Oh god, Mr. Finch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drop the knife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I knew it, Mr. Finch.  I knew you wouldn't desert me.  You're a good man, Finch.  A damn good man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Mr. Susan.  No, I'm not.  I'm a man who does his job and does what he's told.  For twenty seven years, that's all I've been.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Careful, Mr. Finch.  He's quick as the devil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've read Delia's diary over and over all year.  It sickens me but I am unable to judge her.  I am as guilty as she.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Finch, what are you doing? Shoot him.  Kill the bastard, Finch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have no excuse.  I did what I was told to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finch, I order you to shoot him! Finch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My job was to find you and catch you.  I've done my job.  I've done it for the last time.  I'm tired of it.  I'm tired of it all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kill him yourself if you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, V.  And goodbye. V Goodbye, Mr. Finch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I warned you, Finch, the penalty for treason is death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you ready to die? V The real question is, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you really believe you can pick up that knife before I pull this trigger? V No.  But I don't have to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The front door opens and Helen enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks up the stairs to the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Creedy?  Creedy, you dumb bastard, you left your car parked in front.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did I tell you?  Creedy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She steps into the room, her sole and heel sinking into the plush carpet soaked with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When she sees Creedy's head mashed open, she covers her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conrad has propped himself against the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crawls toward her, slipping on the wet carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches for her foot, his hand gloved with wet red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She checks her watch; two hours to midnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conrad seizes hold of her ankle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The look in his eyes frightens her.  She tries to kick free of him but he won't let go.  Twisting, she reaches for the door but slips on the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crawls up her body still clutching the bloody knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conrad raises the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The knife falls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my god.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Helen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Conrad!  What have you done?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won, Helen.  I did it.  I won. I'm the better man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've been through a bad patch, Helen.  But now, he's gone... There's nothing to come between us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't touch me!  You stupid piece of shit!  You've ruined it!  I had it all planned perfectly and you've ruined it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to get out of here!  I have to get away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Helen -- HELEN No!  Let go!  Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Conrad, damn you!  Let me go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Helen, you're not leaving me... not this time... not ever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, please!  Oh god, no!  Oh god, please help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one can help us, Helen.  God is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey hears V on the spiral staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scarlet footprints trail behind V as he struggles down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods and then collapses, rolling down the rest of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running to him, she falls to his side.  His clothes are slick with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His voice strains beneath the mask. V I have done that which I came to do.  Now, it is time for me to rest and with me the past will, at last, find peace. Trembling, Evey holds him. V But the world, the world is not saved... Do not think that, when the fires die and the smoke clears, there is no miracle... there is only a path... upon which they must learn to rule themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches up and wipes a tear from her cheek. V I kept my promise to you, Evey... Now you must promise me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holding him as tight as she can, she feels his life drain away, slipping through her arms in the way the last grains of sand pour through the neck of the hourglass. She buries her face beside his and weeps.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You came back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god, what happened? V Evey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You need a doctor. V It's too late for that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, don't say that! V Evey, listen to me.  I've not long and there are things that must be said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, they need you, V. V Not me, Evey, not me.  I told you I am the villain.  The destroyer... But yes, they will need help...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? V Promise me... you will discover the face under this mask... but you will never look beneath it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand. V Promise me.  Please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise. V Sweet Eve.  Wherever I shall go, I shall always love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: you are not going anywhere! V Midnight... Midnight.  Eve... Make them remember...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to die, V! V Let me be there, Evey, when it begins... Please, let me hear the music, one last time... my music...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't let you die! V I know you won't... I know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! V My love... Ave Atque vale...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An enormous crowd has begun to gather in the streets surrounding the New Government Building.  With the crowd, a restlessness swells against each barricade erected by the military. A sergeant stands on an armored car, speaking through a megaphone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Return to your homes!  There is nothing to see!  The terrorist is dead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He ain't dead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll be here, just like he said!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evey huddles against the stair railing, her face tear stained, staring at the lifeless body of V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She touches the mask, her fingers finding its edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her fingers stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey stares into the eyes, the dark, empty eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her expression changes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small smile creeps across her face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I remember... I remember staring at the mask, at that smile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Part of me couldn't believe he was dead and maybe that was why.  The smile was still the same. It made me want to tear it off so I could see the face, so I could see that he was dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But I had promised. V (V.O.) You will discover the face under this mask but you will never look beneath it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I began to try to imagine his face. Of course, I had long pictured my father behind that smile but I knew in my heart that V was not my father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yet every time I pictured another face, any face, something was lost, something important was somehow diminished.  V was more than a face.  V was V.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And then, quite suddenly, quite naturally, I realized whose face must be beneath that mask.  It was the only face that mattered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't let you die. V (V.O.) I know you won't... I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Midnight approaches and the crowd feels it.  Spilling everywhere, they fill the streets like a flood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey sets a final violet carson on the chest of V.  He is lying on a bed made of gelignite, covered in roses. Touching his mask, she bends over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tenderly, she presses her lips to the smile, her eyes closing, her final tears blinking free. She backs away and V smiles, his lips wet with her kiss, his cheek wet with her tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the train platform, Evey reaches through the window and starts the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wheels churn as the train lurches forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She watches the train disappear into the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, my love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "Ave Atque vale."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I looked it up the next morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "Hail and farewell." V (V.O.) "Make them remember..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They will, my love.  They will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The crowd surges against a barricade when a voice cries out across the city echoing through the megaphone on every corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High above the gathered mass, a masked figure steps out onto a roof parapet. The crowd explodes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "Remember, remember, the fifth of November!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The train barrels along, screaming against its rusted rails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dressed as V, Evey stands on the roof's edge, speaking into a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, the crowd bursts into a frenzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The voice booms over the mesmerized crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She feels the sea of humanity beneath her, almost channeling their energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd screams as one and their scream becomes -- INT.  SUBWAY The train hurling like a bullet through a gun barrel.  Ahead the tracks end, buried beneath the rubble of the collapsed tunnel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have come here tonight to keep a promise.  A promise that is over four hundred years old.  Tonight I am here to give you your freedom!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Since mankind's dawn a handful of oppressors have accepted the responsibility over our lives, responsibility that we should have accepted ourselves.  By doing so, they took our power.  By doing nothing, we gave it away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tonight, our world will change. Our leaders will be gone and we must choose what comes next.  A return to the chains of others or lives of our own.  A world of the past or one of the future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let us choose carefully, London, and when we do, let us mark well and remember, remember this fifth of November!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Inside the rattling train, V lays in perfect repose. V (V.O.) Let me be there, Evey, when it begins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hidden and alone, Evey pulls the mask from her face. V (V.O.) Please let me hear the music... one last time... my music. Almost unconsciously, Evey raises her hand and coaxes the first soft notes as he had once done. V (V.O.) At first, you have to listen carefully. The violins of the 1812 overture steadily rise. V (V.O.) Ah, yes.  There it is.  Beautiful, is it not? Evey smiles, her hand still gently conducting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, my love.  Yes it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: With the clash of cymbals, the train crashes into the wall of rubble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire building opens like a time-lapsed rose blooming with brilliant orange petals of flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd is awash in the baptismal glow of erupting flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evey watches the explosion, a star-burst of flaming debris searing against the night sky like fireworks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The masses burst through the barricades with a euphoric frenzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The explosion begins to slowly die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks down at the mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fire fades and Evey turns, cradling the mask, and walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I know that there is only one way to repay him for what he did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And I know that that way is going to take a lot of hard work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I know this like I know the sun will rise tomorrow and beneath that new sun, our work will begin.
dialogue.name: dialogue
